newsitem.title: USA: Mission West, DMB/SVP trim purchase price.
newsitem.headline: Mission West, DMB/SVP trim purchase price.

text.p: Mission West Properties said it and DMB/SVP California Investments LLC had agreed to trim the price Mission West would pay for DMB/SVP properties to $38.25 million.
The company said in a statement late on Thursday that the Mission West board had established Aug 23 as a revised record date for a shareholder meeting planned for early October to vote on the sale.
DMB/SVP has exercised its right under the purchase agreement not to buy Mission West's Palomar Airport leasehold interests and operations.

Therefore "the parties have negotiated a purchase price reduction of $3.5 million," the company said. The two companies "have fixed the cost to cure certain physical defects in the properties being sold at $250,000.
"As a result of the above, the adjusted purchase price of the assets of the company other than the leasehold properties is $38.25 million," the company said.
